title: Effective Video Design Strategies for Online Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Language Proficiency and Experience with Online Learning
context.additional_context: Need for video design to support project-based language learning in smartphone-centric, resource-constrained technological environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain language grammar structures and key expressions with over 80% accuracy through online lecture videos.
Learners can perform context-appropriate communication in the target language via video-based project activities (e.g., role-play video production).
Learners can autonomously utilize optimized video interfaces (e.g., playback speed adjustment, subtitle display) in mobile environments for self-directed learning.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
